segments.text: I watch the woman drying dishes, her focus unwavering, as if nothing else matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It strikes me how the mundane task of dish drying can blind someone to the world around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A part of me admires her dedication; the other part feels sympathy for her ignorance of the flood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children’s antics, however, are what really draw my attention now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy looks so determined, and yet he’s on the verge of disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can see the girl’s eager expression, practically begging for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s something endearing about their teamwork, but it’s also reckless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think back to my own childhood, the thrill of stealing cookies from the jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I can’t shake the worry that this might end with someone getting hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What will happen when the woman finally discovers the mess they’ve created?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The chaos of the interior is in stark contrast to the tidy garden beyond the window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside looks so peaceful, while inside I sense an impending calamity.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water trickles down the cabinets, making the scene all the more chaotic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s a beautiful day outside, yet the atmosphere here feels heavy with potential accidents.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish the woman would just look around; perhaps then she would realize the storm brewing behind her back.
segments.speaker: PAR
